title: 4 Simple Ways to Change Your Browser's Default Language

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . It's in the top-right corner of the Google Chrome window. A drop-down menu will open. If you're using a Mac, you can't change your Chrome language settings from within Chrome. Skip to the Safari method to see how to change your Mac's default language, which will change the language used by Chrome. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This option is in the drop-down menu. The Settings page will open.

steps.title: Click Languages.
steps.content: Click Languages . You can find this in the left panel, underneath On startup .

steps.title: Click ⋮ next to the language you want.
steps.content: Click ⋮ next to the language you want. This should be underneath the Preferred languages header. If you don't see your preferred language, click Add language , click a language, and then click Add .

steps.title: Check the box for "Display Google Chrome in this language".
steps.content: Check the box for "Display Google Chrome in this language". You'll need to close Chrome and open it again to apply the changes.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . It's in the top-right corner of the Firefox window . A drop-down menu will appear. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . You can find this towards the bottom of the menu. If you aren't already on the General tab, select it from the left panel to navigate there now.

steps.title: Scroll down and select the "Language" drop-down menu.
steps.content: Scroll down and select the "Language" drop-down menu. You can find this underneath the Language and Appearance header.

steps.title: Select your preferred language.
steps.content: Select your preferred language. If you don't see your preferred language, click Search for more languages… . Click Select more languages to add , select a language, and then click Add . Close Mozilla Firefox and open it again to apply the changes.

steps.title: Click ••• .
steps.content: Click ••• . This is at the top-right corner of the Microsoft Edge browser window.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . You can find this towards the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Click Languages.
steps.content: Click Languages . This is in the left panel, under Family safety .

steps.title: Click ••• next to the language you want.
steps.content: Click ••• next to the language you want. This should be in the Preferred languages box. If you don't see your preferred language, click Add languages , click a language, and then click Add .

steps.title: Check the option for "Display Microsoft Edge in this language".
steps.content: Check the option for "Display Microsoft Edge in this language". You'll need to close Microsoft Edge and open it again to apply the changes.

steps.title: Open the Apple menu .
steps.content: Open the Apple menu . This is in the corner of the screen. You can't change your Safari language settings without changing your Mac's language.

steps.title: Click System Settings.
steps.content: Click System Settings . On older devices, this will look like System Preferences .

steps.title: Click General.
steps.content: Click General . This is the cog icon.

steps.title: Click Language & Region.
steps.content: Click Language & Region . You can find this in the right panel. You may need to scroll down.

steps.title: Drag the language you want to the top of the list.
steps.content: Drag the language you want to the top of the list. If you don't see the language you want, click + , select a language, and then click Add . [3] X Research source Restart your device to apply the changes.
